clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Gene Expression Profiling and Immunological Mechanism Affects the Response of Immunotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Gene Expression Profiling and Immunological Mechanism Affects the Response of Malignant Cavity Effusion Towards DC-CIK Immunotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate gene expression profile and immunological associated analysis relating to immunotherapy response of patients with malignant tumor presenting malignant cavity effusion after DC-CIK immunotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. The patients with malignant cavity effusion are treated with dendritic cells (DC) plus cytokine induced killer cells (CIK) locally.
2. Malignant cavity effusion from cancer patients is obtained through puncture and is centrifugalized to get supernatant fluid and enrich cancer cells before and after the therapy.
3. The enriched cancer cells which are flash frozen, as well as the supernatant, are stored at -80°C until processing.
4. The T-Cell Receptor/B-Cell Receptor gene expression in cavity effusion is detected by micro-array to explore the mechanism that DC-CIK immunotherapy controls the malignant cavity effusion.
5. Statistical analysis is performed using unsupervised hierarchical cluster.

primary_outcome.description: T-Cell Receptor and B-Cell Receptor gene expression profiling and the change of cytokines, lymphocytes subpopulation before and after DC-CIK infusion

arm_group.description: T-Cell Receptor/B-Cell Receptor gene expression in cavity effusion is detected by micro-array to explore the mechanism that DC-CIK immunotherapy controls the malignant cavity effusion.

intervention.description: The patients with malignant cavity effusion are treated with dendritic cells (DC) plus cytokine induced killer cells (CIK) locally.

study_pop.textblock: The malignant tumor patients present with malignant cavity effusion and can receive DC-CIK immunotherapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histologically confirmed with malignant tumor and malignant cavity effusion.
2. An Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group（ECOG）performance status of 0-2.
3. Normal cardiac, hepatic, renal and bone marrow functions.
4. Life expectancy >3 months.
5. Not receive other anti-tumor treatment.
6. Not receive chemotherapy in pleural and abdominal cavity.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previous history of other malignancies.
2. Serious or uncontrolled concurrent medical illness.
